column1: Top rowa: telomeric repeating unit sequence and its corresponding base position.
Left columnb: the location of mutated units in IT183 indicated by chromosome arm and the number of the unit.
Position 1 is the closest to subtelomeric region.
All the mutations are assigned to the corresponding position in the original (unmutated) unit.
Insertion is indicated by + nucleotide (e.g. +G at position 3 corresponds to adding G after the third nucleotide of the unit).
Deletion is indicated by - nucleotide (e.g. -G at position 4 corresponds to missing G at the fourth nucleotide of the unit).
Base substitution is indicated by nucleotide to nucleotide  (e.g. G to T at position 10 corresponds to replacing G to T at the tenth nucleotide of the unit).
